member.name: T:Vintasoft.Twain.ImageEncoders.PdfDocumentInfo
member.summary: Class that contains information about PDF document.
member.remarks: You can set all information about PDF document or specify only necessary information. For example, you must set value of the property if you want to update the modification date only.

example.code:
Private Sub SaveLastAcquiredImageToPdf(ByVal acquiredImage1 As AcquiredImage, ByVal productName As String) ' set settings of PDF encoder Dim pdfEncoderSettings1 As TwainPdfEncoderSettings = New TwainPdfEncoderSettings pdfEncoderSettings1.PdfDocumentInfo.Author = "VintaSoft Ltd." pdfEncoderSettings1.PdfDocumentInfo.Title = String.Format("Documents acquired from {0}", productName) pdfEncoderSettings1.PdfDocumentInfo.Creator = "VintaSoft Twain .NET SDK" pdfEncoderSettings1.PdfDocumentInfo.CreationDate = DateTime.Now
' save image to PDF document acquiredImage1.Save("c:\test.pdf", pdfEncoderSettings1) End Sub

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Twain.AcquiredImage.GetAsStream(Vintasoft.Twain.ImageEncoders.TwainImageEncoderSettings)
member.summary: Returns this image as a object.
member.param: Encoder settings.
member.returns: This image as .
member.exception: Thrown if error occurs at the image saving.
member.remarks:
Method:
Returns an image data received from scanner without modifications if image data can be saved to specified image file format, for example, scanner returned image data compressed with CCITT4 compression and you want get data as TIFF file (TIFF supports CCITT4 compression).
Converts image data received from scanner if image data cannot be saved to specified image file format, for example, scanner returned image data compressed with CCITT4 compression and you want get data as BMP file (BMP does not support CCITT4 compression).

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Twain.AcquiredImage.Save(System.String)
member.summary: Saves this image to a file.
member.param: Name of file where image must be saved.
member.exception: Thrown if filename is null.
Thrown if extension of filename is unsupported.
Thrown if error occurs at the image saving.
member.remarks:
Image can be:
- saved as image file (BMP, GIF, JPEG, PNG, TIFF)
- added to multipage TIFF file
- saved into new PDF or PDF/A document
- added to existing PDF or PDF/A document
Available compressions for images saved into TIFF file:
- without compression
- CCITT Group 4 Fax compression
- LZW compression
- ZIP compression
- JPEG compression
Available compressions for images saved into PDF document:
- without compression
- CCITT Group 4 Fax compression
- LZW compression
- ZIP compression
- JPEG compression
Image can be added to PDF document compatible with version 1.4 or earlier of PDF standard.
Image will be saved as BMP file if path has a 'bmp' extension.
Image will be saved as GIF file if path has a 'gif' extension.
Image will be saved as PNG file if path has a 'png' extension.
Image will be saved as new TIFF file or added to existing TIFF file if path has a 'tif' or 'tiff' extension.
Image will be saved into new PDF file or added to existing PDF file if path has a 'pdf' extension.
Image will be saved as JPEG file for all other extensions.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Twain.AcquiredImage.Despeckle(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes noise from image.
member.param: Maximal quantity of pixels in small noise. Possible values: 0 - 100. Default value is 8. What is "small noise" see below.
Maximal quantity of pixels in medium noise. Possible values: 0 - 100. Default value is 25. What is "medium noise" see below.
Radius of area around medium noise in which there are no "good objects". Possible values: 0 - 100. Default value is 30. What is "good objects" see below.
Maximal quantity of pixels in "border" noise. Possible values: 0 - 3000. Default value is 400. What is "border noise" see below.
member.remarks:
This method removes noise from image. Current algorithm removes three types of noise:
1. Small noise - a set of pixels (non background pixels) with quantity of pixels less than value of level1 parameter. This set of pixels will be replaced to background pixels.
2. Medium noise - a set of pixels (non background pixels) with quantity of pixels less than value of level2 parameter. This set of pixels will be replaced to background pixels if around this set of pixels in a region with radius of value of radius parameter there is no "good objects". "Good object" - not a noise.
3. "Border" noise - a set of pixels (non background pixels) with quantity of pixels less than value of level3 parameter. This set of pixels will be replaced to background pixels if at least one pixel from this set of pixels is located on an image border.
Here is a "good" sequence of operations for image processing:
1. Despeckle an image ( method)
2. Deskew an image ( method)
3. Detect image border ( method)

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Twain.AcquiredImage.Deskew(Vintasoft.Twain.BorderColor,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Deskew an image, i.e. detects a correct position of image.
member.param: Free space around rotated image will be filled with this color.
Specifies scan interval for X axis. Recommended value is 5.
Specifies scan interval for X axis. Recommended value is 5.
member.remarks:
Here is a "good" sequence of operations for image processing:
1. Despeckle an image ( method)
2. Deskew an image ( method)
3. Detect image border ( method)
Possible values for scanIntervalX and scanIntervalY parameters: 1 - every column (row) will be scanned, 2 - every second column (row) will be scanned, 3 - every third column (row) will be scanned, and so on. Big values of these parameters may speed up deskewing process, but may worsen results.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Twain.AcquiredImage.DetectBorder(System.Int32)
member.summary: Detects the border around the image.
member.param: Size of border around the image. Possible values: 0 - 100. Default value is 5.
member.remarks:
Here is a "good" sequence of operations for image processing:
1. Despeckle an image ( method)
2. Deskew an image ( method)
3. Detect image border ( method)
Possible values for scanIntervalX and scanIntervalY parameters: 1 - every column (row) will be scanned, 2 - every second column (row) will be scanned, 3 - every third column (row) will be scanned, and so on. Big values of these parameters may speed up deskewing process, but may worsen results.

member.name: T:Vintasoft.Twain.Device
member.summary: Class that allows to manipulate TWAIN device.
member.remarks:
Class allows to:
get information about the device
open / close the device
enable / disable the device
control the document feeder of the device
control the image layout of the device
access standard capabilities of the device (, , etc)
access all capabilities of the device
enable/disable UI of the device
change the transfer mode of the device
asynchronously acquire images from device
synchronously acquire images from device
get information about current image transfer with events
cancel current image transfer
access acquired image
load / save settings of the device

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Twain.Device.Finalize
member.summary: Releases all resources used by this object.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Twain.Device.Open
member.summary: Opens the device.
member.exception: Thrown if device is disposed.
Thrown if device is in wrong state.
member.remarks: Call this method only when device is closed ( == .Closed).

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Twain.Device.Close
member.summary: Closes the device.
member.exception: Thrown if device is disposed.
Thrown if device is transferring images.
member.remarks:
Call this method only when device is opened ( == .Opened) or device is enabled ( == .Enabled).
Important: Do not call this method when device is transferring images ( == .TransferReady or == .Transferring) - you need to cancel transfer with the method and only then call this method.

member.exception: Thrown if device is disposed.

Thrown if device does not support the setup dialog.
member.remarks: Call this method only when device is opened ( == .Opened).

member.remarks: Call this method only when device is closed ( == .Closed) or device is opened ( == .Opened).

member.name: E:Vintasoft.Twain.Device.ImageAcquiring
member.summary: Occurs when image acquisition starts
member.remarks:
Here is a sequence of events if scan is successfully completed:
for each acquired image
event occurs before image is acquiring
events occurs during image acquisition (only if Memory transfer mode is used)
event occurs after image is acquired
event occurs when scan is completed
event occurs when UI is closed (only if UI is used)
Here is a sequence of events if scan is canceled:
for each acquired image
event occurs before image is acquiring
events occurs during image acquisition (only if Memory transfer mode is used)
event occurs after image is acquired
event occurs when scan is canceled
Here is a sequence of events if scan is failed:
for each acquired image
event occurs before image is acquiring
events occurs during image acquisition (only if Memory transfer mode is used)
event occurs after image is acquired
event occurs when scan is failed

member.name: T:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId
member.summary: Specifies available device capabilities.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.XferCount
member.summary: The application is willing to accept this number of images.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.ICompression
member.summary: Allows the application and Source to identify which compression schemes they have in common for Buffered Memory and File transfers.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IPixelType
member.summary: The type of pixel data that a Source is capable of acquiring (for example, black and white, gray, RGB, etc.).

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IUnits
member.summary: Determines the unit of measure for all quantities.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IXferMech
member.summary: Allows the application and Source to identify which transfer mechanisms they have in common.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.Author
member.summary: The name or other identifying information about the Author of the image. It may include a copyright string.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.Caption
member.summary: A general note about the acquired image.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.FeederEnabled
member.summary: If TRUE, Source must acquire data from the document feeder acquire area and other feeder capabilities can be used. If FALSE, Source must acquire data from the non-feeder acquire area and no other feeder capabilities can be used.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.FeederLoaded
member.summary: Reflect whether there are documents loaded in the Source's feeder.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.TimeDate
member.summary: The date and time the image was acquired.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.SupportedCaps
member.summary: Returns a list of all the capabilities for which the Source will answer inquiries. Does not indicate which capabilities the Source will allow to be set by the application.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.ExtendedCaps
member.summary: Allows the application and Source to negotiate capabilities to be used in States 5 and 6.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.AutoFeed
member.summary: If TRUE, the Source will automatically feed the next page from the document feeder after the number of frames negotiated for capture from each page are acquired.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.ClearPage
member.summary: If TRUE, the Source will eject the current page being acquired from and will leave the feeder acquire area empty.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.FeedPage
member.summary: If TRUE, the Source will eject the current page and advance the next page in the document feeder into the feeder acquire area.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.RewindPage
member.summary: If TRUE, the Source will return the current page to the input side of the document feeder and feed the last page from the output side of the feeder back into the acquisition area.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.Indicators
member.summary: If TRUE, the Source will display a progress indicator during acquisition and transfer, regardless of whether the Source's user interface is active. If FALSE, the progress indicator will be suppressed if the Source's user interface is inactive.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.SupportedCapsExt
member.summary: Returns a list of all the capabilities for which the Source will answer inquiries.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.PaperDetectable
member.summary: This capability determines whether the device has a paper sensor that can detect documents on the ADF or Flatbed.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.UIControllable
member.summary: If TRUE, indicates that this Source supports acquisition with the UI disabled. If FALSE, indicates that this Source can only support acquisition with the UI enabled.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.DeviceOnline
member.summary: If TRUE, the physical hardware (e.g., scanner, digital camera, image database, etc.) that represents the image source is attached, powered on, and communicating.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.AutoScan
member.summary: This capability is intended to boost the performance of a Source.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.ThumbnailsEnabled
member.summary: Allows an application to request the delivery of thumbnail representations for the set of images that are to be delivered.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.Duplex
member.summary: This indicates whether the scanner supports duplex. If so, it further indicates whether one-path or two-path duplex is supported.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.DuplexEnabled
member.summary: The user can set the duplex option to be TRUE or FALSE. If TRUE, the scanner scans both sides of a paper; otherwise, the scanner will scan only one side of the image.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.EnableDsUiOnly
member.summary: Queries an application to see if it implements the new user interface settings dialog.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.CustomDsData
member.summary: Allows the application to query the data source to see if current settings of device can be get/set.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.EndOrSer
member.summary: Allows the application to specify the starting endorser / imprinter number. All other endorser/imprinter properties should be handled through the data source's user interface.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.JobControl
member.summary: Allows multiple jobs in batch mode.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.Alarms
member.summary: Turns specific audible alarms on and off.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.AlarmVolume
member.summary: The volume of a device's audible alarm. Note that this control affects the volume of all alarms; no specific volume control for individual types of alarms is provided.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.AutomaticCapture
member.summary: The number of images to automatically capture. This does not refer to the number of images to be sent to the Application, use DeviceCapability.XferCount for that.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.TimeBeforeFirstCapture
member.summary: For automatic capture, this value selects the number of milliseconds before the first picture is to be taken, or the first image is to be scanned.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.TimeBetweenCaptures
member.summary: For automatic capture, this value selects the milliseconds to wait between pictures taken, or images scanned.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.ClearBuffers
member.summary: MSG_GET reports the presence of data in the scanner's buffers. MSG_SET with a value of TWCB_CLEAR immediately clears the buffers.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.MaxBatchBuffers
member.summary: Describes the number of pages that the scanner can buffer when DeviceCapability.AutoScan is enabled.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.DeviceTimeDate
member.summary: The date and time of the device's clock.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.PowerSupply
member.summary: MSG_GET reports the kinds of power available to the device. MSG_GETCURRENT reports the current power supply in use.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.CameraPreviewUI
member.summary: This capability queries the Source for UI support for preview mode. If TRUE, the Source supports preview UI.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.DeviceEvents
member.summary: Specifies which events the Application wants the Source to report.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.SerialNumber
member.summary: A string containing the serial number of the currently selected device in the Source. Multiple devices may all report the same serial number.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.Printer
member.summary: MSG_GET returns the current list of available printer devices, along with the one currently being used for negotiation.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.PrinterEnabled
member.summary: Turns the current DeviceCapability.Printer device on or off.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.PrinterIndex
member.summary: The User can set the starting number for the current DeviceCapability.Printer device.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.PrinterMode
member.summary: Specifies the appropriate current DeviceCapability.Printer device mode.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.PrinterString
member.summary: Specifies the string(s) that are to be used in the string component when the current DeviceCapability.Printer device is enabled.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.PrinterSuffix
member.summary: Specifies the string that shall be used as the current DeviceCapability.Printer device's suffix.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.Language
member.summary: Allows Application and Source to identify which languages they have in common for the exchange of string data, and to select the language of the internal UI.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.FeederAlignment
member.summary: Helps the Application determine any special actions it may need to take when negotiating frames with the Source.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.FeederOrder
member.summary: TWFO_FIRSTPAGEFIRST if the feeder starts with the top of the first page. TWFO_LASTPAGEFIRST is the feeder starts with the top of the last page.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.ReacquireAllowed
member.summary: Indicates whether the physical hardware (e.g. scanner, digital camera) is capable of acquiring multiple images of the same page without changes to the physical registration of that page.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.BatteryMinutes
member.summary: The minutes of battery power remaining to the device.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.BatteryPercentage
member.summary: When used with MSG_GET, return the percentage of battery power level on camera. If -1 is returned, it indicates that the battery is not present.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.CameraSide
member.summary: Sets the top and bottom values of cameras in a scanning device. Supported from TWAIN 1.91.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.Segmented
member.summary: Describes the segmentation setting for captured images. Supported from TWAIN 1.91.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.AutomaticSenseMedium
member.summary: Specifies whether to acquire images from the Automatic Document Feeder or from the Flatbed.
member.value:
true - always attempts to acquire first image from the Automatic Document Feeder; if paper is not present in the feeder, then images are acquired from the Flatbed.
false - source of images (feeder or flatbed) is determined by the FeederEnabled capability.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.CameraEnable
member.summary: Delivers images from the current camera. Supported from TWAIN 2.0.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.CameraOrder
member.summary: Selects the order of output for Single Document Multiple Image mode. Supported from TWAIN 2.0.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.MicrEnabled
member.summary: Enables actions needed to support check scanning. Supported from TWAIN 2.0.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.FeederPrep
member.summary: Improve the movement of paper through a scanner ADF. Supported from TWAIN 2.0.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.FeederPocket
member.summary: Report what pockets are available as paper leaves a device. Supported from TWAIN 2.0.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.CustomInterfaceGuid
member.summary: Uniquely identifies an interface for a Data Source. Supported from TWAIN 2.1.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.DoubleFeedDetection
member.summary: Controls the way the data source detects double feed events.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.DoubleFeedDetectionLength
member.summary: Adjusts double feed detection for document length.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.DoubleFeedDetectionSensitivity
member.summary: Adjusts double feed detection for ultrasonic.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.DoubleFeedDetectionResponse
member.summary: Adjusts how the data source handles double feed events.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.PaperHandling
member.summary: Control paper handling.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IndicatorsMode
member.summary: Controls GUI messages allowed when the full GUI isn’t being displayed. Supported from TWAIN 2.2.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.PrinterVerticalOffset
member.summary: Y-Offset for current Printer device. Supported from TWAIN 2.2.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.PowerSaveTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the camera power down timer in seconds. Supported from TWAIN 1.8.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.SupportedExtImageInfo
member.summary: Lists all of the information that the Source is capable of returning from a call to DAT_EXTIMAGEINFO. Supported from TWAIN 2.1.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IAutoBright
member.summary: TRUE enables and FALSE disables the Source's Auto-brightness function (if any).

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IBrightness
member.summary: The brightness values available within the Source.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IContrast
member.summary: The contrast values available within the Source.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.ICustomHalftone
member.summary: Specifies the square-cell halftone (dithering) matrix the Source should use to halftone the image.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IExposureTime
member.summary: Specifies the exposure time used to capture the image, in seconds.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IFilter
member.summary: Describes the color characteristic of the subtractive filter applied to the image data. Multiple filters may be applied to a single acquisition.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IFlashUsed
member.summary: Specifies whether or not the image was acquired using a flash.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IGamma
member.summary: Gamma correction value for the image data.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IHalftones
member.summary: A list of names of the halftone patterns available within the Source.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IHighlight
member.summary: Specifies which value in an image should be interpreted as the lightest "highlight."

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IImageFileFormat
member.summary: Informs the application which file formats the Source can generate (MSG_GET). Tells the Source which file formats the application can handle (MSG_SET).

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.ILampState
member.summary: TRUE means the lamp is currently, or should be set to ON. Sources may not support MSG_SET operations.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.ILightSource
member.summary: Describes the general color characteristic of the light source used to acquire the image.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IOrientation
member.summary: Defines which edge of the "paper" the image's "top" is aligned with. This information is used to adjust the frames to match the scanning orientation of the paper.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IPhysicalWidth
member.summary: The maximum physical width (X-axis) the Source can acquire (measured in units of IUnits).

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IPhysicalHeight
member.summary: The maximum physical height (Y-axis) the Source can acquire (measured in units of IUnits).

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IShadow
member.summary: Specifies which value in an image should be interpreted as the darkest "shadow." All values "darker" than this value will be clipped to this value.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IFrames
member.summary: The list of frames the Source will acquire on each page.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IXNativeResolution
member.summary: The native optical resolution along the X-axis of the device being controlled by the Source. Most devices will respond with a single value (TW_ONEVALUE).

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IYNativeResolution
member.summary: The native optical resolution along the Y-axis of the device being controlled by the Source.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IXResolution
member.summary: All the X-axis resolutions the Source can provide.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IYResolution
member.summary: All the Y-axis resolutions the Source can provide.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IMaxFrames
member.summary: The maximum number of frames the Source can provide or the application can accept per page. This is a bounding capability only. It does not establish current or future behavior.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.ITiles
member.summary: This is used with buffered memory transfers. If TRUE, Source can provide application with tiled image data.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IBitOrder
member.summary: Specifies how the bytes in an image are filled by the Source. TWBO_MSBFIRST indicates that the leftmost bit in the byte (usually bit 7) is the byte's Most Significant Bit.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.ICcittKFactor
member.summary: Used for CCITT Group 3 2-dimensional compression. The ‘K’ factor indicates how often the new compression baseline should be re-established. A value of 2 or 4 is common in facsimile communication. A value of zero in this field will indicate an infinite K factor—the baseline is only calculated at the beginning of the transfer.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.ILightPath
member.summary: Describes whether the image was captured transmissively or reflectively.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IPixelFlavor
member.summary: Sense of the pixel whose numeric value is zero (minimum data value).

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IPlanarChunky
member.summary: Allows the application and Source to identify which color data formats are available. There are two options, "planar" and "chunky."

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IRotation
member.summary: How the Source can/should rotate the scanned image data prior to transfer. This doesn't use IUnits. It is always measured in degrees. Any applied value is additive with any rotation specified in IOrientation.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.ISupportedSizes
member.summary: For devices that support fixed frame sizes. Defined sizes match typical page sizes. This specifies the size(s) the Source can/should use to acquire image data.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IThreshold
member.summary: Specifies the dividing line between black and white.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IXScaling
member.summary: All the X-axis scaling values available. A value of '1.0' is equivalent to 100% scaling. Do not use values less than or equal to zero.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IYScaling
member.summary: All the Y-axis scaling values available. A value of '1.0' is equivalent to 100% scaling. Do not use values less than or equal to zero.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IBitOrderCodes
member.summary: Used for CCITT data compression only. Indicates the bit order representation of the stored compressed codes.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IPixelFlavorCodes
member.summary: Used only for CCITT data compression. Specifies whether the compressed codes' pixel "sense" will be inverted from the Current value of IPixelFlavor prior to transfer.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IJpegPixelType
member.summary: Specifies the JPEG pixel type.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.ITimeFill
member.summary: Used only with CCITT data compression. Specifies the minimum number of words of compressed codes (compressed data) to be transmitted per line.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IBitDepth
member.summary: Specifies the pixel bit depths for the Current value of IPixelType.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IBitDepthReduction
member.summary: Specifies the Reduction Method the Source should use to reduce the bit depth of the data. Most commonly used with IPixelType = PixelType.BW to reduce gray data to black and white. Supported from TWAIN 1.5.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IUndefinedImageSize
member.summary: If TRUE the Source will issue a MSG_XFERREADY before starting the scan. Supported from TWAIN 1.6.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IImageDataSet
member.summary: Gets or sets the image indices that will be delivered during the standard image transfer done in States 6 and 7. Supported from TWAIN 1.7.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IExtImageInfo
member.summary: Allows the application to query the data source to see if it supports the new operation triplet DG_IMAGE/DAT_EXTIMAGEINFO/MSG_GET. Supported from TWAIN 1.7.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IMinimumHeight
member.summary: Allows the source to define the minimum height (Y-axis) that the source can acquire. Supported from TWAIN 1.7.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IMinimumWidth
member.summary: Allows the source to define theminimum width (X-axis) that the source can acquire. Supported from TWAIN 1.7.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IFlipRotation
member.summary: Flip rotation is used to properly orient images that flip orientation every other image. Supported from TWAIN 1.8.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IBarCodeDetectionEnabled
member.summary: Turns bar code detection on and off. Supported from TWAIN 1.8.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.ISupportedBarCodeTypes
member.summary: Provides a list of bar code types that can be detected by the current Data Source. Supported from TWAIN 1.8.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IBarCodeMaxSearchPriorities
member.summary: The maximum number of supported search priorities. Supported from TWAIN 1.8.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IBarCodeSearchPriorities
member.summary: A prioritized list of bar code types dictating the order in which bar codes will be sought. Supported from TWAIN 1.8.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IBarCodeSearchMode
member.summary: Restricts bar code searching to certain orientations, or prioritizes one orientation over the other. Supported from TWAIN 1.8.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IBarCodeMaxRetries
member.summary: Restricts the number of times a search will be retried if none are found on each page. Supported from TWAIN 1.8.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IBarCodeTimeout
member.summary: Restricts the total time spent on searching for a bar code on each page. Supported from TWAIN 1.8.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IZoomFactor
member.summary: Returns all camera supported lens zooming range or sets zooming value. Supported from TWAIN 1.8.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IPatchCodeDetectionEnabled
member.summary: Turns patch code detection on and off. Supported from TWAIN 1.8.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.ISupportedPatchCodeTypes
member.summary: A list of patch code types that may be detected by the current Data Source. Supported from TWAIN 1.8.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IPatchCodeMaxSearchPriorities
member.summary: The maximum number of supported search priorities. Supported from TWAIN 1.8.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IPatchCodeSearchPriorities
member.summary: A prioritized list of patch code types dictating the order in which patch codes will be sought. Supported from TWAIN 1.8.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IPatchCodeSearchMode
member.summary: Restricts patch code searching to certain orientations, or prioritizes one orientation over the other. Supported from TWAIN 1.8.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IPatchCodeMaxRetries
member.summary: Restricts the number of times a search will be retried if none are found on each page. Supported from TWAIN 1.8.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IPatchCodeTimeout
member.summary: Restricts the total time spent on searching for a patch code on each page. Supported from TWAIN 1.8.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IFlashUsed2
member.summary: For devices that support flash. MSG_SET selects the flash to be used (if any). MSG_GET reports the current setting. This capability replaces IFlashUsed, which is only able to negotiate the flash being on or off. Supported from TWAIN 1.8.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IImageFilter
member.summary: For devices that support image enhancement filtering. This capability selects the algorithm used to improve the quality of the image. Supported from TWAIN 1.8.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.INoiseFilter
member.summary: For devices that support noise filtering. This capability selects the algorithm used to remove noise. Supported from TWAIN 1.8.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IOverScan
member.summary: Overscan is used to scan outside of the boundaries described by IFrames, and is used to help acquire image data that may be lost because of skewing. Supported from TWAIN 1.8.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IAutomaticBorderDetection
member.summary: Turns automatic border detection on and off. Supported from TWAIN 1.8.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IAutomaticDeskew
member.summary: Turns automatic deskew correction on and off. Supported from TWAIN 1.8.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IAutomaticRotate
member.summary: When TRUE this capability depends on intelligent features within the Source to automatically rotate the image to the correct position. Supported from TWAIN 1.8.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IJpegQuality
member.summary: Specifies quality for JPEG images. Supported from TWAIN 1.91.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IFeederType
member.summary: Allows the Application to set scan parameters depending upon the type of feeder. Supported from TWAIN 1.91.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IIccProfile
member.summary: Embeds or links ICC profiles into files. Supported from TWAIN 1.91.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IAutoSize
member.summary: Force the output image dimensions to match either the current value of ISupportedSizes or any of its current allowed values. Supported from TWAIN 2.0.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IAutoDiscardBlankPages
member.summary: Discards blank pages. Supported from TWAIN 2.0.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IAutomaticCropUsesFrame
member.summary: Reduces the amount of data captured from the device, potentially improving the performance of the driver. Supported from TWAIN 2.1.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IAutomaticLengthDetection
member.summary: Controls the automatic detection of the length of a document, this is intended for use with an Automatic Document Feeder. Supported from TWAIN 2.1.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IAutomaticColorEnabled
member.summary: Detects the pixel type of the image and returns either a color image or a non-color image specified by AutomaticColorNonColorPixelType. Supported from TWAIN 2.1.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IAutomaticColorNonColorPixelType
member.summary: Specifies the non-color pixel type to use when automatic color is enabled. Supported from TWAIN 2.1.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IColorManagementEnabled
member.summary: Disables the Source's color and gamma tables for color and grayscale images, resulting in output that that could be termed "raw". Supported from TWAIN 2.1.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IImageMerge
member.summary: Merges the front and rear image of a document in one of four orientations: front on the top. Supported from TWAIN 2.1.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IImageMergeHeightThreshold
member.summary: Specifies a Y-Offset in ICAP_UNITS units. Supported from TWAIN 2.1.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IFilmType
member.summary: Specify the type of transmissive media (positive or negative). Supported from TWAIN 2.2.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IMirror
member.summary: Controls output of a mirror image of the input document. Supported from TWAIN 2.2.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.IJpegSubsampling
member.summary: Selects JPEG quantization. Supported from TWAIN 2.2.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.PrinterCharRotation
member.summary: Rotates characters printed on documents. Supported from TWAIN 2.3.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.PrinterFontStyle
member.summary: Selects characteristics of the font printed on documents (ex: bold, italic). Supported from TWAIN 2.3.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.PrinterIndexLeadChar
member.summary: Selects the left side padding of numeric values printed on documents (ex: zero fill). Supported from TWAIN 2.3.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.PrinterIndexMaxValue
member.summary: Maximum allowed value for DeviceCapabilityId.PrintIndex. Supported from TWAIN 2.3.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.PrinterIndexNumDigits
member.summary: Total number of digits allowed in DeviceCapabilityId.PrinterIndex. Supported from TWAIN 2.3.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.PrinterIndexStep
member.summary: Step size when incrementing DeviceCapabilityId.PrinterIndex for each document. Supported from TWAIN 2.3.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.PrinterIndexTrigger
member.summary: Kinds of documents that cause DeviceCapabilityId.PrinterIndex to increment. Supported from TWAIN 2.3.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceCapabilityId.PrinterStringPreview
member.summary: A sample string representing the currently selected printing options. Supported from TWAIN 2.3.

member.summary: Operation worked.

member.summary: General failure. Unload Source immediately.

member.summary: Not enough memory to complete operation.

member.summary: Source Manager unable to find the specified Source.

member.summary: Source is connected to maximum supported number of applications.

member.summary: Source or Source Manager reported an error to the user and handled the error; no application action required.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.TwainConditionCode.BadCap
member.summary: Capability not supported by Source or operation is not supported on capability, or capability had dependencies on other capabilities and cannot be operated upon at this time.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.TwainConditionCode.BadProtocol
member.summary: Unrecognized operation triplet.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.TwainConditionCode.BadValue
member.summary: Data parameter out of supported range.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.TwainConditionCode.SeqError
member.summary: Illegal operation for current Source Manager or Source state.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.TwainConditionCode.BadDest
member.summary: Unknown destination in DSM_Entry.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.TwainConditionCode.CapUnsupported
member.summary: Capability not supported by Source.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.TwainConditionCode.CapBadOperation
member.summary: Operation (i.e., Get or Set) not supported on capability.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.TwainConditionCode.CapSeqError
member.summary: Capability has dependencies on other capabilities and cannot be operated upon at this time.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.TwainConditionCode.Denied
member.summary: File System operation is denied (file is protected).

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.TwainConditionCode.FileExists
member.summary: Operation failed because file already exists.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.TwainConditionCode.FileNotFound
member.summary: File not found.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.TwainConditionCode.NotEmpty
member.summary: Operation failed because directory is not empty.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.TwainConditionCode.PaperJam
member.summary: Transfer failed because of a feeder error.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.TwainConditionCode.PaperDoubleFeed
member.summary: Transfer failed because of a feeder error.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.TwainConditionCode.FileWriteError
member.summary: File write error.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.TwainConditionCode.CheckDeviceOnline
member.summary: Check the device status.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.TwainConditionCode.Interlock
member.summary: Operation failed because the cover or door is open.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.TwainConditionCode.DamagedCorner
member.summary: Operation failed because the document has a damaged corner.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.TwainConditionCode.FocusError

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.FormConfidence
member.summary: The confidence that the specified form was detected. This is an array property with a confidence factor for each form In the data set with 0 meaning no match and 100 meaning absolute certainty. Typically values over 70 imply a good form match with the template.
member.value: Value type: UInt32, allowed values from 0 to 100.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.FormTemplateMatch
member.summary: The array of file names for the master forms matched against a form. If multi-page master forms are used, the associated page numbers are contained in the FORMTEMPLATEPAGEMATCH capability array.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.FormTemplatePageMatch
member.summary: An array containing the number of the page from a multi-page master form matched against a form image. It is useful when matching a form image against the pages of a multi-page master form. The file name of the master form is contained in the FORMTEMPLATEMATCH capability.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.FormHorzDocOffset
member.summary: An array containing the perceived vertical offsets of the form image being matched against a set of master forms. This is useful for page registration once the form has been recognized.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.FormVertDocOffset
member.summary: An array containing the perceived vertical offsets of the form image being matched against a set of master forms. This is useful for page registration once the form has been recognized.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.BarcodeCount
member.summary: Returns the number of bar codes found on the document image. A value of 0 means the bar code engine was enabled but that no bar codes were found. A value of -1 means the bar code engine was not enabled.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.BarcodeConfidence
member.summary: This number reflects the degree of certainty the bar code engine has in the accuracy of the information obtained from the scanned image and ranges from 0 (no confidence) to 100 (supreme confidence). The Source may return a value of -1 if it does not support confidence reporting.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.BarcodeRotation
member.summary: The bar code’s orientation on the scanned image is described in reference to a Western-style interpretation of the image.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.BarcodeTextLength
member.summary: The number of ASCII characters derived from the bar code.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.DeshadeCount
member.summary: Returns the number of shaded regions found and erased in the document image. A value of 0 means the deshade engine was enabled but that no regions were processed. A value of -1 means the deshade engine was not enabled.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.DeshadeBlackCountOld
member.summary: The total number of black pixels in the region prior to deshading. If this value is unknown the Source returns -1.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.DeshadeBlackCountNew
member.summary: The total number of black pixels in the region after deshading. If this value is unknown the Source returns -1.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.DeshadeBlackRlMin
member.summary: The shortest black pixel run-length in the region prior to deshading. If this value is unknown the Source returns -1.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.DeshadeBlackRlMax
member.summary: The longest black pixel run-length in the region prior to deshading. If this value is unknown the Source returns -1.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.DeshadeWhiteCountOld
member.summary: The total number of white pixels in the region prior to deshading. If this value is unknown the Source returns -1.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.DeshadeWhiteCountNew
member.summary: The total number of white pixels in the region after deshading. If this value is unknown the Source returns -1.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.DeshadeWhiteRlMin
member.summary: The shortest white pixel run-length in the region prior to deshading. If this value is unknown the Source returns -1.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.DeshadeWhiteRlAverage
member.summary: The average length of all white pixel run-lengths in the region prior to deshading. If this value is unknown the Source returns -1.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.DeshadeWhiteRlMax
member.summary: The longest white pixel run-length in the region prior to deshading. If this value is unknown the Source returns -1.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.BlackSpecklesRemoved
member.summary: The number of black speckles removed from the image when despeckle is enabled.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.WhiteSpecklesRemoved
member.summary: The number of white speckles removed (black speckles added) from the image when despeckle is enabled.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.HorzLineCount
member.summary: Returns the number of horizontal lines found and erased in the document image. A value of 0 means the line removal engine was enabled but that no lines were found. A value of -1 means the line engine was not enabled.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.VertLineCount
member.summary: Returns the number of vertical lines found and erased in the document image. A value of 0 means the line removal engine was enabled but that no lines were found. A value of -1 means the line engine was not enabled.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.DeskewStatus
member.summary: Returns the status of the deskew operation.
member.value:
Value type: UInt32.
Possible values:
0 - Image successfully deskewed
1 - Deskew information only
2 - Deskew failed
3 - Deskew engine not enabled

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.SkewOriginalAngle
member.summary: Deskew engine not enabled

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.SkewFinalAngle
member.summary: The amount of skew in the deskewed image. This number may not be zero.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.SkewConfidence
member.summary: This number reflects the degree of certainty the deskew engine has in the accuracy of the deskewing of the current image and ranges from 0 (no confidence) to 100 (supreme confidence). The Source may return a value of -1 if it does not support confidence reporting.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.SkewWindowX1

member.summary: The Y image coordinate of the upper right corner of the virtual deskewed image.

member.summary: The Y image coordinate of the lower left corner of the virtual deskewed image.

member.summary: The X image coordinate of the lower right corner of the virtual deskewed image.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.SkewWindowY4
member.summary: The Y image coordinate of the lower right corner of the deskewed image.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.Camera
member.summary: The primary use of this value is to determine if the image is from the top or the bottom side of a sheet of paper. This is accomplished by naming the camera that was used to obtain the image. For Sources that support DAT_FILESYSTEM, the Application can use the string to determine if the camera is capturing images from the top or bottom side of the paper.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.FrameNumber
member.summary: Chronological index of the acquired frame.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.Frame
member.summary: Gets information about image layout of the device.

member.value: Value type: UInt16, allowed values: 0 or 1.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.IccProfile
member.summary:
Returns the name of the ICC profile that was used to render the current image. This may be a fully qualified path indicating the exact location of the ICC profile.
If this is not a fully qualified path, then the default location is operating system dependant.
Windows default location:
windows_path\system32\spool
Supported from TWAIN 1.91.
member.value: Value type: string(255), allowed values: any valid ICC profile file name or fully qualified path.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.LastSegment

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.SegmentNumber
member.summary: Returns a number identifying the segment of an image. Supported from TWAIN 1.91.

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.MagData

member.name: F:Vintasoft.Twain.ExtendedImageInfoId.MagType

member.value: Value type: UInt16, allowed values: TWMD_MICR (0).

member.summary: Gets the current image layout rectangle of document/page/frame.
member.returns: Current image layout rectangle.
member.remarks:
The image layout rectangle defines what portion of the device's scanning area will be acquired.
Document number can be set using the property, Page number can be set using the property, Frame number can be set using the property
Call this method only when device is opened ( == .Opened).
This method has effect only if you do not use the User Interface ( = false).

member.name: T:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceManager
member.summary: Class that allows to manipulate TWAIN device manager.
member.remarks:
Class allows to:
determine that TWAIN is installed in the system
choose which TWAIN device manager to use (1.x or 2.x)
specify path to TWAIN device manager
get number of TWAIN devices installed in the system
select the device
get access to object that manipulates TWAIN device

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Releases all resources used by this object.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceManager.Open
member.summary: Opens the TWAIN device manager.
member.exception:
Thrown if
TWAIN device manager is not found - TWAIN_32.DLL or TWAINDSM.DLL file is not found
TWAIN device manager is not loaded - TWAIN_32.DLL cannot be loaded in 64-bit system, recompile the project in x86 mode
TWAIN device manager is not initialized
parent window is not found - run method in the Loaded handler of the form
Thrown if object is disposed.
member.remarks: Only property can be used before this method. All other properties and methods must be used only after execution of this method.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceManager.Close
member.summary: Closes the TWAIN device manager.
member.exception: Thrown if TWAIN device manager is not closed.
Thrown if device is in wrong state.
Thrown if object is disposed.

member.summary: Displays the default device selection dialog so the user can change the default device.
member.returns:
true - if the user has pressed the "Ok" button,
false - if an error occured or if the user has pressed the "Cancel" button.
member.exception: Thrown if device manager is not open.
Thrown if object is disposed.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceManager.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceManager.IsTwainAvailable
member.summary: Determines that TWAIN is installed in the system.
member.value: true - TWAIN Data Source Manager is found, false - TWAIN Data Source Manager not found.
member.remarks: Path to the TWAIN Data Source Manager can be set manually in the property.
member.exception: Thrown if object is disposed.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceManager.IsTwain2Compatible
member.summary: Determines that TWAIN 2.x Data Source Manager should be used.
member.value:
true - TWAINDSM.DLL should be used as Data Source Manager,
false (default value) - TWAIN_32.DLL should be used as Data Source Manager. Default value is false.
member.remarks: Path to the TWAIN Data Source Manager will be detected anew when value of this property is changed.
member.exception: Thrown if object is disposed.
Thrown if device manager is not closed.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceManager.TwainDllPath
member.summary: Gets or sets path to the TWAIN Data Source Manager.
member.exception: Path cannot be null.
File does not exist or not a DLL file.
member.remarks: This property should be used when non standard path to the TWAIN Data Source Manager is used, for example on Citrix.
member.exception: Thrown if object is disposed.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Twain.DeviceManager.ApplicationProductName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of application which uses SDK.
member.value:
The string value which specifies the application name. String must contain at least 8 symbols, but not more than 31 symbol.
Default is "VintaSoft Twain".
member.remarks:
This property can be used when you want to scan images without UI, but you want to use progress indicator. For example, HP's scanners show the following message in the progress indicator: "Scanning to Vintasoft Twain...". Using this property you can change message in the progress indicator, for example, to the following: "Scanning to YourApplicationName...".
This property should be used before the method.
member.exception: Thrown if object is disposed.

member.remarks: Value of this property can be set in the constructor of this class.
member.exception: Thrown if object is disposed.

member.name: T:Vintasoft.Twain.ImageUploading.Ftp.FtpUpload
member.summary: Provides an asynchronous uploading of files to FTP server.
member.remarks:
Class allows to:
transfer multiple files asynchronously
get answer from the server
get information about status of an uploading process
get information about a progress of an uploading process
get information about error if an uploading process was not completed successfully
abort an uploading process

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Twain.ImageUploading.Ftp.FtpUpload.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks:
Use this constructor only if your application does not have a window or you cannot access it, for example, in JavaScript.
Image uploading process can be monitored with , , and properties.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Twain.ImageUploading.Ftp.FtpUpload.#ctor(System.ComponentModel.ISynchronizeInvoke)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Context which should receive class events.
member.remarks:
Use this constructor if your application is a window forms application.
Image uploading process can be monitored with , and events and , , and properties.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Twain.ImageUploading.Ftp.FtpUpload.AddFile(System.String,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Adds file information to the FTP request.
member.param: File name.
Stream with the data of the file field.
member.returns: true if information about file was added successfully, false otherwise.
member.exception: Thrown if file name or memory stream is null.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Twain.ImageUploading.Ftp.FtpUpload.ClearFiles
member.summary: Clears file information in FTP request.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Twain.ImageUploading.Ftp.FtpUpload.PostData
member.summary: Sends data to the FTP server.
member.returns: true if upload process was started successfully, false otherwise.
member.exception: Thrown if host is null.
Thrown if there is no files to transfer.
member.remarks:
This method initializes asynchronous file uploading process and file will be uploaded to the server only when the event will be generated or value of the property will be set to .Completed.
An uploading process can be aborted with the method.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Twain.ImageUploading.Ftp.FtpUpload.Abort
member.summary: Aborts current uploading process.
member.remarks: An image uploading process will not be aborted immediately, it will be aborted (completed correctly) only when a event will be fired.

member.name: T:Vintasoft.Twain.ImageUploading.Http.HttpUpload
member.summary: Provides an asynchronous uploading of files to HTTP or HTTPS server.
member.remarks:
Class allows to:
transfer multiple files asynchronously
get answer from the server
use any authentication methods supported by .NET Framework
get information about status of an uploading process
get information about a progress of an uploading process
get information about error if an uploading process was not completed successfully
abort an uploading process

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Twain.ImageUploading.Http.HttpUpload.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks:
Use this constructor only if your application does not have a window form or you cannot access it, for example, in JavaScript.
Image uploading process can be monitored with , , and properties.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Context which should receive class events.
member.remarks:
Use this constructor if your application is a window forms application.
Image uploading process can be monitored with , and events and , , and properties.

member.summary: Clears the file fields in HTTP request.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Twain.ImageUploading.Http.HttpUpload.PostData
member.summary: Sends data to the HTTP/HTTPS server by the POST method.
member.returns: true if upload process was started successfully, false otherwise.
member.exception: Thrown if URL is null.
member.remarks:
This method initializes asynchronous file uploading process and file will be uploaded to the server only when the event will be generated or value of the property will be set to .Completed.
An uploading process can be aborted with the method.

member.name: M:Vintasoft.Twain.ImageUploading.Http.HttpUpload.Abort
member.summary: Aborts current uploading process.
member.remarks: An image uploading process will not be aborted immediately, it will be aborted (completed correctly) only when a event will be fired.

member.remarks: Cookie instances must be delimited by commas, here is an example: CUSTOMER=WILE_E_COYOTE, path=/, expires="Wednesday, 09-Nov-99 23:12:40 GMT"

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Twain.ImageUploading.Http.HttpUpload.Timeout
member.summary: Get or sets the timeout, in milliseconds, assigned to the read-write operations with server.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Twain.ImageUploading.Http.HttpUpload.UseDefaultCredentials
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that controls whether default credentials are sent with requests.
member.value: true if the default credentials are used; otherwise false. Default value is false.
member.remarks: Set this property to true when requests made by this object should, if requested by the server, be authenticated using the credentials of the currently logged on user. For client applications, this is the desired behavior in most scenarios. For middle tier applications, such as ASP.NET applications, instead of using this property, you would typically set the property to the credentials of the client on whose behalf the request is made.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Twain.ImageUploading.Http.HttpUpload.Credentials
member.summary: Provides authentication information for the request.
member.remarks: The Credentials property contains authentication information to identify the maker of the request. The Credentials property can be either an instance of , in which case the user, password, and domain information contained in the NetworkCredential instance is used to authenticate the request, or it can be an instance of , in which case the uniform resource identifier (URI) of the request is used to determine the user, password, and domain information to use to authenticate the request.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Twain.ImageUploading.Http.HttpUpload.AllowAutoRedirect
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the request should follow redirection responses.
member.value: true if the request should automatically follow redirection responses from the Internet resource; otherwise false. Default value is true.
member.remarks:
Set AllowAutoRedirect to true if you want redirect the request automatically to the new location of the resource. The maximum number of redirections can be set with the property.
If AllowAutoRedirect is set to false all responses with an HTTP status code from 300 to 399 will be returned to the application.

member.name: P:Vintasoft.Twain.ImageUploading.Http.HttpUpload.MaximumAutomaticRedirections
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of redirects that the request will follow.
member.value: The maximum number of redirection responses that the request will follow. Default value is 5. Maximal value is 50.
member.remarks: The MaximumAutomaticRedirections method property sets the maximum number of redirections for the request to follow if the property is true.
